alert.note: Alert for Ripley (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 9:10AM CDT until March 28 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river in Missouri... Current River near Doniphan affecting Ripley County. .Heavy rain over the last day will result in significant rises on the Current River. The river is forecast to crest at Doniphan half a foot below moderate flood stage early Sunday evening. For the Current River...including Doniphan...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Current River near Doniphan. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Water flows across Jefferson Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 11.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 17.5 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Monday evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
